turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Nah, skip that... I'm going to have to keep an eye on you, though.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: You promise to stay down there for an hour?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: You expect me to believe that?

turns.speaker: CATO
turns.text: Running this place for a fella in town. Nothing much to speak of.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well, I don't notice us hustling trash, either.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: That's what he told you, huh?

turns.speaker: CATO
turns.text: Kit... Maybe I'd better get a shovel.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Don't you ever get bored around here?

turns.speaker: CATO
turns.text: Sometimes. The other day, though, an old boy was plowing in the field over there, found some old Spanish coins.

turns.speaker: CATO
turns.text: Kind of round, like so... Gold. I'll show you if you want.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: That your spider in there? In that bottle?

turns.speaker: CATO
turns.text: Oh, flies... grasshoppers when I can catch 'em.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: You ever held another job before?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I used to throw trash for the City.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Wouldn't be here if I hadn't.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: What kind of work do you think you would be qualified for?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I can't think of anything at the moment... I'd like you to write me out a slip, though, proving I came down here.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Long as my ammo held out... Right there's where you caught me.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: You better not leave that Cadillac sitting out here.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Say, what kind of rifle was that you were shooting at me?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: You ever had to open it up like that before?

turns.speaker: DEPUTY
turns.text: Kit... Kit, I've got a question for you.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I don't know. Always wanted to be a criminal, I guess. Just not this big a one... Takes all kinds though.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Hey, listen, Tom, I don't mean to tell you how to run your show here but these cuffs are pinching. What do you say now?

turns.speaker: DEPUTY
turns.text: I need to get your signature on some papers here, Kit.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well, I've got to read them first. Suppose I could get a Coke while I do?

turns.speaker: DEPUTY
turns.text: Holly's over here, Kit, if you want to see her.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I know you do. Good luck to you, too.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: What'd you come out here for?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I wasn't aware there was any law against it.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: You know, before I met her, nobody could ask me how I was doing with my girl. Matter of fact, I didn't really have one.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Listen. I got a lot of respect for her, sir.  That's about as good a one as I know to tell you.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Well, it's not good enough.  Just what do you think would happen to her if she stuck around with you, Kit? Guy like you.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: She'd get along okay. And if she didn't, well, she could take off, just take off, I wouldn't mind... I'd always tell people I deserved it.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I've got a gun here, sir. It's always a good idea to have one around.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: What do you think you're doing? Go on, get out of here.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well, I got it all planned... and I'm taking Holly off with me.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: For coming onto my property... With a gun.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: What's going to happen to Jack and me?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You have to ask Kit. He says frog, I jump.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I've got to stick by Kit... He feels trapped.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well, I've felt that way, hadn't you?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Hi, I'm Kit. I'm not keeping you from anything important, am I?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well, I was just messing around over there, thought I'd come over and say hello to you.  I'll try anything once.  What's your name? I said mine.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Listen, Holly, you want to take a walk with me?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well. I got some stuff to say. Guess I'm kind of lucky that way. Most people don't have anything on their minds, do they?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Oh, incidentally, my last name is Carruthers. Sounds a little too much like "druthers", doesn't it?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well, nobody asked me what I thought. They just hung it on me.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Nah, I got me a job.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well, I don't mind getting up early, so I got a job throwing garbage... I'm not in love with the stuff, okay.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: That's my father. I got to run.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Hey, wait a minute. When am I going to see you again?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well, I know what my daddy's going to say.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well, that I shouldn't be seen with anybody that collects garbage.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Now what's he know about garbage, huh?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well, I mean there's nothing he wants to know about it... I've got to run.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Just seemed like the right move... Whatcha doing?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: How do you say "Quit my Job" in Spanish?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Yeah, well, I'm going to work as a cowboy now... Or thinking about it. It's a routine, like anything. What do you think?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: You want to go for a ride?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah, but I don't like it.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Just don't... I've got a headache.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Can I come around and see you tomorrow?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Yeah, the tree makes it nice.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: And the flowers... Let's not pick them. They're so nice.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: There's an old Fudgesicle over there. You want it?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Somebody else is going to get it.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Kids eat that kind of stuff in Korea.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Did it go the way it 'uz supposed to?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Is that all there is to it?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Gosh, what was everybody talking about?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: That we should crunch our hands with this stone. That way we'd never forget what happened today.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Okay, but I'm going to keep it for a souvenir...

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: We better call the doctor... Listen. I'll say how it happened, part I saw.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well... I don't think that'd work.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: You don't believe me, see for yourself.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Listen, maybe we ought to tell somebody about this.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: You said that once already... Too late now.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: They're not going to listen to me. You either. Are you kidding?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Suppose the neighbors heard the noise?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Wouldn't be funny... Listen, I'll be back in a while.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: "The Kon-Tiki in motion was a little different from what it usually was in such conditions. We had become sensitive to changes in the rhythm of the logs. I thought at once of suction from the coast, which was drawing near, and was continually out on the deck and up the mast..."

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I found a lid. It was laying on the ground over there.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I got him in the stomach.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: He didn't say anything to me about it.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Whatcha looking in there for? We can't afford any of that.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well, I'm not going down there and look.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: What'd you put him in there for?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Just to keep him out of the sun.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Yeah, you look tired... Listen, honey. when all this is over, I'm going to sit down and buy you a big, thick steak.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well, we'll see about that... Hey, lookie.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Later we found out she was deaf and we hadn't even known it.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Hey, why're you always walking ahead of me?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well, why you always walking behind me?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Anybody ever done that to you before?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Guess there's no way I'll ever know. For sure.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I'd like to get out of here.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Soon as I start the car... and fix my hat.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: "Rumor: Pat Boone is seriously considering giving up his career so he can return to school full-time and complete his education. Fact: Pat has told intimates that so long as things are going well for his career, it's the education that will have to take the back seat."

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: "Rumor: Frank Sinatra and Rita Hayworth are in love... Fact: True, but not with each other."

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I never been to Montana... Acquaintance of mine has, but I hadn't... Never had any reason to.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Why not? I mean, I'm having fun... At least I'm not bitching.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Well, I feel kind of like an animal living out here. I mean, there's no place to bathe and... no place to get anything good to eat.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well, I'll catch you a big trout. Soon as we get to the mountains.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Maybe we should've tried to hop it.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I could've pulled the car up on the tracks, slowed it down some.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: Yeah, then we'd be stuck here.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well, maybe we oughta be stuck here. I'm not saying that I know.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well, maybe the slope here is throwing it off some. We ought to find a more flat place.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Never mind. It doesn't matter... If I'm worth a damn, I'll pick the right direction. And if I'm not, well, I don't care. See what I mean?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well, I shouldn't expect miracles, should I?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Nothing... I was just running off at the mouth... as usual.

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: You know... they'd probably ask to see your driver's license before they hired you.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well. I'm not going to let that stop me.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Boy. I had a feeling today was going to be the day... Helicopter.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: He's not coming to take us for a ride, either. Come on, let's make a run for the car.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Have you got a better idea?

turns.speaker: HOLLY
turns.text: I just don't want to go.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Course it's too bad about your dad.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: We're going to have to sit down, and talk about that sometime.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Yeah, but the thing about him, he's down with the flu. He's sick.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Yeah. I'd invite you inside, except it's contagious. Don't want to start an epidemic.

turns.speaker: VISITOR
turns.text: No, of course not. It's only that he called last night and asked if I could come by.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well, he didn't have it last night.

turns.speaker: VISITOR
turns.text: Well, I'd like to leave a message, if that's okay.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Sorry to barge in on you. Anybody else here besides you two?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Good deal... Oh, uh, we're on the run and we'd like to hang out here for a while. Couple of hours, maybe. How'd that be?

turns.speaker: RICH MAN
turns.text: Stay as long as you like.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Good a way to kill time as any... She okay?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Listen, ah... We're going to take the Cadillac for a while. How'd that be?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Don't worry, I won't let her drive.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Morning... Say, you got any gas?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well. I'm sorry, sir, but we've got to ask you for it.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: See, we're about out... been driving all night. Actually, I don't even have time to explain it to you.

turns.speaker: ROUGHNECK
turns.text: Well, matter of fact, I don't have any.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Just a second now. That's your truck. isn't it?

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Well, listen. I'm going to swap you my Cadillac.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: Name is Carruthers. Believe I shoot people every now and then. Not that I deserve a medal.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: I could've held off an army if I could've gotten behind a rock in the mountains.

turns.speaker: KIT
turns.text: You tossed my hat out the window.

turns.speaker: NEW JERSEY
turns.text: So we'll help.  Let's get crackin'!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: All these people applied for drivers' licenses in the same town in New Jersey on the exact same date.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Forty-six Yoyodyne employees.  Grover's Mill, New Jersey, 11/1/38.

turns.speaker: NEW JERSEY
turns.text: November 1, thirty days have September, April, June, and November...when short February's done, all the rest have thirty-one. October 31st!  Halloween!  Don't you get it?  Orson Welles!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You mean the guy from the old wine commercials?

turns.speaker: NEW JERSEY
turns.text: Halloween. 1938..."War of the Worlds"...that fake radio news broadcast that got everybody scared, thinking that real live Martians were landing in Grover's Mill, New Jersey!  But then it all just turned out to be a hoax.

turns.speaker: CASPER LINDLEY
turns.text: Forgive the butterfingers, Buckaroo.  Casper Lindley, Knight of the Blue Shield, at your disposal.  And my son, Scooter.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Nothing to apologize for, Casper.  You've gone beyond the call of duty tonight.  Mind if I get on the horn and radio the Cavaliers--?  They'll be worried.

turns.speaker: CASPER LINDLEY
turns.text: She gotta be kiddin', right? Vaporize the whole damn planet--?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: You wanna take the chance, Casper?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Rawhide, go find out how Professor Hikita's coming with that formula. Mrs. Johnson, take Casper and Scooter, gas up the Jet Car.

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: See 'em?  They about had me and the whole damn car for breakfast. Broke my windshield...

turns.speaker: PROF. HIKITA
turns.text: The creatures?  They attacked you?  They tried to possess you?

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: Smells fermented.  Check in with the Institute, Reno, see if everything's kosher.

turns.speaker: PROF. HIKITA
turns.text: Buckaroo, I've done an advanced spectrograph analysis on the specimen you pulled off the Jet Car drive shaft.

turns.speaker: PROF. HIKITA
turns.text: Rawhide tells me Dr. Lizardo escaped...

turns.speaker: BUCKAROO BANZAI
turns.text: I'm assigning a couple Blue Shields to protect you around the clock, just in case.
